answerText: "The Handsomest Drowned Man in the World" [or "El Ahogado más Hermoso del Mundo"][10] This author wrote "The Handsomest Drowned Man in the World" and "A Very Old Man with Enormous Wings" as well as a novel in which Santiago Nasar is stabbed outside of his home.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 5 | 10 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The title character of this story is at first thought to be an enemy ship or a whale and is later thought to have been able to catch fish by calling their names. For 10 points each: [10] Identify this short story in which a corpse is named Esteban and is given elaborate funeral rites before being thrown off a cliff.
